sentences.chinese: 你的行为使我们大家丢脸。

sentences.english: I will not dishonour my teacher.
sentences.chinese: 我不想让我的老师丢脸。

sentences.english: Harry is in disgrace because of his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 哈里因为行为失检而丢脸。

sentences.english: I will not demean myself by cheating on the examination.
sentences.chinese: 我不会因考试作弊而使自己丢脸。

sentences.english: Each side wishes to concede only what can be conceded without loss of face.
sentences.chinese: 每一方都只肯承认一些承认后不会丢脸的东西。

sentences.english: Her rejection dashed and humiliated him.
sentences.chinese: 她的拒绝使他难堪和丢脸。
你的行为使我们大家丢脸。

sentences.english: Pen forgot his humiliation in his surprise.
sentences.chinese: 潘吃惊得忘记了那件丢脸的事。

sentences.english: Some children cheat simply because they don't like the humiliation of losing.
sentences.chinese: 有些孩子动则作弊是因为他们觉得输了很丢脸。

sentences.english: He made a real pig of himself at the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 他在餐厅里大吃大喝，真丢脸。

sentences.english: It is humiliating before others to have a diarrhoea ptomaine poisoning or to vomit from it.
sentences.chinese: 由于食物中毒而腹泻或者呕吐，是在别人面前丢脸。

sentences.english: "I feel so much shame for putting up with that stuff for so long," she says, referring to my father's boorish behavior.
sentences.chinese: 这么久了，一提起你爸爸做的那些傻事我还觉得丢脸。

sentences.english: I'm shamed to be your friend.
sentences.chinese: 作为你的朋友我都感到丢脸。

sentences.english: If a men wear a high shoes like women, he will feel embarrassing and humiliate.
sentences.chinese: 如果男人穿女式高跟鞋，他们会觉得很冏很丢脸。

sentences.english: I was ashamed of being watched like a bird in a cage.
sentences.chinese: 像一只笼中鸟一样被观赏让我觉得很丢脸。

definition: to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
ashamed/embarrassed/not having the face (to meet people)/not daring (out of shame)
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to embarrass oneself/to make a fool of oneself
